EFL HOU THE MAN Aston Villa transfer news: Conor Hourihane signs from Barnsley as Villa boss Steve Bruce makes third signing in two days 
Irish midfielder becomes second Tykes player to join Villa in last 24 hours following arrival of right-back James Bree By MIKE McGRATH Comments CONOR HOURIHANE has completed his move to Aston Villa. 
The Irish midfielder has been in talks over a move from Barnsley and has now been unveiled as a Villa player. Twitter 8 Aston Villa have confirmed the signing of Conor Hourihane from Barnsley 
Steve Bruce made the 25-year-old one of his priority signings of the January transfer window and has been attempting to seal a £3million deal for one of the top performers in the Championship this season. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Aston Villa news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
Hourihane had six months left on his deal at Oakwell and set his heart on a move to Villa after they made their move to land him. 
Bruce worked with Hourihane at Sunderland when the Irish star was in the youth ranks – and he was keen to get him in his squad. He has been a driving force behind Barnsley’s surprise run into the top half of the Championship following promotion last season via the play-offs. 
Bruce also picked up Birkir Bjarnason from Swiss club Basel yesterday, having netted former Forest skipper Henri Lansbury earlier in the window.
